content:
Sure! Here is an example of how the schedule for a round-robin tournament with 9 teams playing 3-on-3 basketball might look if you are playing 2 games per day for 15 minutes each on Saturdays from 8:15pm to 9pm starting on January 21, 2023:

| Date | Team 1 | Team 2 | Team 3 | Team 4 | Team 5 | Team 6 | Team 7 | Team 8 | Team 9 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1/21 8:15pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1/21 8:30pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1/28 8:15pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1/28 8:30pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/4 8:15pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/4 8:30pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/11 8:15pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/11 8:30pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/18 8:15pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/18 8:30pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/25 8:15pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 2/25 8:30pm |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |

To fill in the match-ups, you can use a random draw or you can try to evenly distribute the stronger teams throughout the schedule. It's up to you how you want to do it.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
